Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the changes to Social Security were supported by Barack Obama without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there were reports of the GOP insisting on changes to Social Security during the fiscal cliff negotiations, as mentioned by liberal columnist Paul Krugman.
Understate: The claim may understate the extent of the controversy surrounding the GOP's insistence on changes to Social Security during the fiscal cliff negotiations.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the claim, such as differing interpretations of the negotiations or differing perspectives on the proposed changes to Social Security.
